alert.note: Alert for Madison; Page; Rappahannock; Shenandoah; Warren (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 22 at 5:08PM EDT until June 22 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Madison County in northwestern Virginia... Eastern Shenandoah County in northwestern Virginia... Southwestern Warren County in northwestern Virginia... Eastern Page County in northwestern Virginia... West central Rappahannock County in northwestern Virginia... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 508 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles northeast of Luray, or 10 miles southeast of Woodstock, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Luray, Stanley, Big Meadows, Fairview, Kimball, Bentonville, Compton, Panorama, Ida, Pine Grove, Skyland and Rileyville. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
